item.title: verilog manuals excerpts
item.description: module 3 intro HSL supports multiple level of abstraction behavior: algorithm RTL: nets and registers gate: built-in and user-define primitives switch Abstraction example – divided by 2 behavioral: always @(din) // block executed on every change in `din` dout = din/2; RTL: always @(posedge clk) dout <= din >> 1; //speicial "nonblocking" assignment Structural FD1 op[3:0] ( .
